UniprotID	P49321-2
Accession	P49321;A8K6H2;B4DQP3;D3DQ07;F5H3J2;Q53GW5;Q5T622;Q5T625;Q96A69;Q9BTW2
EntryName	NASP_HUMAN
ProteinName	Nuclear autoantigenic sperm protein (NASP)
GeneName	NASP
Length	449
Function	Component of the histone chaperone network (PubMed:22195965). Binds and stabilizes histone H3-H4 not bound to chromatin to maintain a soluble reservoir and modulate degradation by chaperone-mediated autophagy (PubMed:22195965). Required for DNA replication, normal cell cycle progression and cell proliferation. Forms a cytoplasmic complex with HSP90 and H1 linker histones and stimulates HSP90 ATPase activity. NASP and H1 histone are subsequently released from the complex and translocate to the nucleus where the histone is released for binding to DNA.
Subcellular Location	Cytoplasm; Nucleus
Disorder	
ExposeBuried	
SurfaceAccessbility	
SecondStructure	
Hydropathy	
Polar	
Charge
